Description: The amount of memory to be used for the environment. The value entered must be followed by an “m” to indicate how many megabytes to use. For example, to allocate 512 megabytes of memory, you would enter 512m. If not specified, 512 megabytes of memory will be allocated.

This property is only used for JBoss environments on UNIX. JBoss environments on Windows set this value but do not use the value after the environment is deployed. This property allows you to specify any options to be passed to the Java virtual machine. Garbage collections and the ability to disable just in time compilation are added when the environment is installed. Any other JVM options can be set on this property. On JBoss installations for Unix, the build.xml script will set this value to -Djava.awt.headless=true. All other bundles will leave this value blank.
The username of Administrator
The password of Administrator
The authentication system to use; either UMS, which is the default, or one of the following SSO mechanisms: KERBEROS, PROXY, SAML.
Used to exclude a host in DMZ.

A passphrase used to encrypt the token. We recommend that the passphrase contain a minimum of 30 characters.
The ISSUER must be a lowercase value and match the value specified in the JWT "iss" claim.
The Windows NT Domain user to use when using Windows Integrated authentication.
The password, in encrypted format, of the Windows NT Domain user to use when using Windows Integrated authentication.
The name of the Kerberos configuration file to use when Kerberos authentication is enabled.
A test user to be used when testing the system without a valid proxy server.
The Entity Descriptor ID specified in the Identity Provider Metadata.
The file path to the Identity Provider Metadata.
The prefix of objects saved in AWS S3
Used for TMC deployments. Provides list of databases to deploy for when the app instance first starts up
Used for TMC deployments. Provides the database image to use for the deployment of the databases (i.e. prod_gen, rdqa_gen, train_gen, etc.)
Used for transferring to and from AWS S3 for the File In and File Out processes
The database type. Possible values are: sqlserver, sqlserver_encrypted, sqlserver_instance, sqlserver_instance_encrypted, oracle, oracle_rac.
Used to indicate whether or not the DB Server is clustered (i.e. Oracle RAC)
Used for TMC deployments. Provides the directory where the data file is deployed to in the case of Microsoft SQL Server
Used for TMC deployments. Provides the default tablespace where the where the database is installed in the case of Oracle
Used for TMC deployments. Defines whether the database is installed on-premise style (ONPREMISE) or AWS RDS (AWS)
Used for TMC deployments. Provides the directory where the image is deployed
Used for TMC deployments. Provides the default tablespace where the indices of the database is installed in the case of Oracle
Used for TMC deployments. Provides the directory where the log file is deployed
The database server host name or IP address.
Used for TMC deployments. Provides the temp tablespace for the database installation in the case of Oracle
Used for TMC deployments. Defines whether the database is Microsoft SQL Server (MSSQL) or Oracle (ORACLE)
The database server instance name (SQL Server) or SID (Oracle).
The database server port.
The database server connection user (SQL Server).
The database server connection password (SQL Server).
Used for TMC deployments. Defines the Docker version deployed
The directory where to drop or retrieve data files used by the import/export feature.
The directory where the application is installed.
The logs directory.
The directory for storing temporary files.
The account name of the application.
The instance name of the application.
The name of the environment. Default value: env.account.name_env.app.instance.name
For future use.
Defines the file path to the license file
The application server fully qualified host name.
The port to use to connect to the application server prefixed with a colon (:).
The protocol to use to connect to the application server.
The deployment type of the application server
The list of domains, separated by commas, that can be used when redirecting to other URLs. If left blank, all domains can be redirected.
The network domain name.
Used for TMC deployments. To control whether or not the container exits of failure or stays alive so that personal can view a failed status.  Used for Continuous Integration pipeline only
For future use.
Used for TMC deployments to simulate a mock deployment
For future use.

The bootstrap database set. Default: db.set.name.
The connection pool class to use for an Oracle bootstrap database. If that property is not specified, no connection pool will be used and connections will be cached in beans.
The user name for the Oracle bootstrap database.
The encrypted password for the Oracle bootstrap database.
The driver to use for the Oracle bootstrap database.
The JDBC URL for the Oracle bootstrap database.
The database type for the Oracle bootstrap database. Must be set to 2.
When set, the application will try to enable database explain for this database. If explain is supported by the database, the output will be sent to the debug file.
Will provide the timeout value in seconds whenever the application requires a timeout. If 0 is specified, the application will not use a timeout for any SQL.
